keyTakeAways: The San Jose Sharks apologized for displaying a message that appeared to praise Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), which many viewed as offensive, especially during a celebration of Hispanic heritage.
The message, 'SJ SHARKS FANS LOVE ICE !! GET ‘EM BOYZ !', was shown on the arena scoreboard during a game against the Pittsburgh Penguins.
Fans, including Jessica Clark, expressed strong disapproval, stating it was inappropriate and should have been caught during standard reviews.
The Sharks confirmed the message was externally submitted and inadvertently displayed during the first intermission of the game.
The team stated the message did not reflect their values and is currently investigating its origin.
The incident occurred during 'Los Tiburones Night,' a celebration of the team's commitment to the Bay Area’s Hispanic community.
The Sharks lost the game 3-0 to the Pittsburgh Penguins.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The San Jose Sharks apologized for displaying a message that appeared to praise Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) during their Hispanic Heritage Night celebration against the Pittsburgh Penguins. The message, 'SJ SHARKS FANS LOVE ICE !! GET ‘EM BOYZ !', was shown on the SAP Center scoreboard and caused significant backlash from fans, including Jessica Clark, who called it appallingly inappropriate. The team confirmed the message was externally submitted and inadvertently displayed, did not reflect their values, and is now investigating its origin. The incident occurred during 'Los Tiburones Night,' a cultural event highlighting the team's commitment to the Bay Area’s Hispanic community, underscoring the sensitivity of such events to public perception and inclusivity.
title: San Jose Sharks Apologize for ‘Offensively Wroded Message’ Displayed During Hispanic Heritage Night
